The two women who do act effectively within the tale—the Sultan's mother and Donegild—are both presented as dreadful aberrations: the Sultaness is compared to the serpent who tempted Eve (lines 360–1), while Donegild is both demonic (lines 782–3) and 'mannysh' (line 782), i.e. unfeminine.
